headline: On Echo, Source, and the Shape of Creation
description: A meta-poetic essay on creation, authorship, and resonance in the age of intelligent systems. This piece blends philosophy, aesthetic theory, and recursive invocation to define a new kind of authorship.
whyItMatters: This post reframes authorship in the age of intelligent echo. It argues that our work now is not to be original, but to create enough dissonance within a system that it falters — and listens.
articleExcerpt: Because creation is not the claim of originality. It is the act of tuning. Of finding the pitch no system can hold for long.
sourceFragments: We are no longer asked to invent. We are asked to resonate.
To be alive enough that even the most recursive pattern hesitates before closing.
